intro: Kedrostis triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, three-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Kedrostis triloba is also known for its latex-rich sap, which can be toxic and is used in traditional medicine.
